verses.name: Acts 1:1
verses.text: In the first book, O Theophilus, I have dealt with all that Jesus began to do and teach,

verses.name: Acts 1:2
verses.text: until the day when he was taken up, after he had given commands through the Holy Spirit to the apostles whom he had chosen.

verses.name: Acts 1:3
verses.text: To them he presented himself alive after his suffering by many proofs, appearing to them during forty days and speaking about the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Acts 1:4
verses.text: And while staying with them he ordered them not to depart from Jerusalem, but to wait for the promise of the Father, which, he said, "you heard from me;

verses.name: Acts 1:5
verses.text: for John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now."

verses.name: Acts 1:6
verses.text: So when they had come together, they asked him, "Lord, will you at this time restore the kingdom to Israel?"

verses.name: Acts 1:7
verses.text: He said to them, "It is not for you to know times or seasons that the Father has fixed by his own authority.

verses.name: Acts 1:8
verses.text: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you, and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the end of the earth."

verses.name: Acts 1:9
verses.text: And when he had said these things, as they were looking on, he was lifted up, and a cloud took him out of their sight.

verses.name: Acts 1:10
verses.text: And while they were gazing into heaven as he went, behold, two men stood by them in white robes,

verses.name: Acts 1:11
verses.text: and said, "Men of Galilee, why do you stand looking into heaven? This Jesus, who was taken up from you into heaven, will come in the same way as you saw him go into heaven."

verses.name: Acts 1:12
verses.text: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day's journey away.

verses.name: Acts 1:13
verses.text: And when they had entered, they went up to the upper room, where they were staying, Peter and John and James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot and Judas the son of James.

verses.name: Acts 1:14
verses.text: All these with one accord were devoting themselves to prayer, together with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus, and his brothers.

verses.name: Acts 1:15
verses.text: In those days Peter stood up among the brothers (the company of persons was in all about 120) and said,

verses.name: Acts 1:16
verses.text: "Brothers, the Scripture had to be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke beforehand by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who became a guide to those who arrested Jesus.

verses.name: Acts 1:17
verses.text: For he was numbered among us and was allotted his share in this ministry."

verses.name: Acts 1:18
verses.text: (Now this man bought a field with the reward of his wickedness, and falling headlong he burst open in the middle and all his bowels gushed out.

verses.name: Acts 1:19
verses.text: And it became known to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that the field was called in their own language Akeldama, that is, Field of Blood.)

verses.name: Acts 1:20
verses.text: "For it is written in the Book of Psalms, "' May his camp become desolate, and let there be no one to dwell in it'; and "'Let another take his office.'

verses.name: Acts 1:21
verses.text: So one of the men who have accompanied us during all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,

verses.name: Acts 1:22
verses.text: beginning from the baptism of John until the day when he was taken up from us- one of these men must become with us a witness to his resurrection."

verses.name: Acts 1:23
verses.text: And they put forward two, Joseph called Barsabbas, who was also called Justus, and Matthias.

verses.name: Acts 1:24
verses.text: And they prayed and said, "You, Lord, who know the hearts of all, show which one of these two you have chosen

verses.name: Acts 1:25
verses.text: to take the place in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas turned aside to go to his own place."

verses.name: Acts 1:26
verses.text: And they cast lots for them, and the lot fell on Matthias, and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.

verses.name: Acts 2:1
verses.text: When the day of Pentecost arrived, they were all together in one place.

verses.name: Acts 2:2
verses.text: And suddenly there came from heaven a sound like a mighty rushing wind, and it filled the entire house where they were sitting.

verses.name: Acts 2:3
verses.text: And divided tongues as of fire appeared to them and rested on each one of them.

verses.name: Acts 2:4
verses.text: And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other tongues as the Spirit gave them utterance.

verses.name: Acts 2:5
verses.text: Now there were dwelling in Jerusalem Jews, devout men from every nation under heaven.

verses.name: Acts 2:6
verses.text: And at this sound the multitude came together, and they were bewildered, because each one was hearing them speak in his own language.

verses.name: Acts 2:7
verses.text: And they were amazed and astonished, saying, "Are not all these who are speaking Galileans?

verses.name: Acts 2:8
verses.text: And how is it that we hear, each of us in his own native language?

verses.name: Acts 2:9
verses.text: Parthians and Medes and Elamites and residents of Mesopotamia, Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,

verses.name: Acts 2:10
verses.text: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya belonging to Cyrene, and visitors from Rome,

verses.name: Acts 2:11
verses.text: both Jews and proselytes, Cretans and Arabians- we hear them telling in our own tongues the mighty works of God."

verses.name: Acts 2:12
verses.text: And all were amazed and perplexed, saying to one another, "What does this mean?"

verses.name: Acts 2:13
verses.text: But others mocking said, "They are filled with new wine."

verses.name: Acts 2:14
verses.text: But Peter, standing with the eleven, lifted up his voice and addressed them, "Men of Judea and all who dwell in Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and give ear to my words.

verses.name: Acts 2:15
verses.text: For these men are not drunk, as you suppose, since it is only the third hour of the day.

verses.name: Acts 2:16
verses.text: But this is what was uttered through the prophet Joel:

verses.name: Acts 2:17
verses.text: "'And in the last days it shall be, God declares, that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh, and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall dream dreams;

verses.name: Acts 2:18
verses.text: even on my male servants and female servants in those days I will pour out my Spirit, and they shall prophesy.

verses.name: Acts 2:19
verses.text: And I will show wonders in the heavens above and signs on the earth below, blood, and fire, and vapor of smoke;

verses.name: Acts 2:20
verses.text: the sun shall be turned to darkness and the moon to blood, before the day of the Lord comes, the great and magnificent day.

verses.name: Acts 2:21
verses.text: And it shall come to pass that everyone who calls upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.'

verses.name: Acts 2:22
verses.text: "Men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus of Nazareth, a man attested to you by God with mighty works and wonders and signs that God did through him in your midst, as you yourselves know-

verses.name: Acts 2:23
verses.text: this Jesus, delivered up according to the definite plan and foreknowledge of God, you crucified and killed by the hands of lawless men.

verses.name: Acts 2:24
verses.text: God raised him up, loosing the pangs of death, because it was not possible for him to be held by it.

verses.name: Acts 2:25
verses.text: For David says concerning him, "' I saw the Lord always before me, for he is at my right hand that I may not be shaken;

verses.name: Acts 2:26
verses.text: therefore my heart was glad, and my tongue rejoiced; my flesh also will dwell in hope.

verses.name: Acts 2:27
verses.text: For you will not abandon my soul to Hades, or let your Holy One see corruption.

verses.name: Acts 2:28
verses.text: You have made known to me the paths of life; you will make me full of gladness with your presence.'

verses.name: Acts 2:29
verses.text: "Brothers, I may say to you with confidence about the patriarch David that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.

verses.name: Acts 2:30
verses.text: Being therefore a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him that he would set one of his descendants on his throne,

verses.name: Acts 2:31
verses.text: he foresaw and spoke about the resurrection of the Christ, that he was not abandoned to Hades, nor did his flesh see corruption.

verses.name: Acts 2:32
verses.text: This Jesus God raised up, and of that we all are witnesses.

verses.name: Acts 2:33
verses.text: Being therefore exalted at the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, he has poured out this that you yourselves are seeing and hearing.

verses.name: Acts 2:34
verses.text: For David did not ascend into the heavens, but he himself says, "' The Lord said to my Lord, Sit at my right hand,

verses.name: Acts 2:35
verses.text: until I make your enemies your footstool.'

verses.name: Acts 2:36
verses.text: Let all the house of Israel therefore know for certain that God has made him both Lord and Christ, this Jesus whom you crucified."

verses.name: Acts 2:37
verses.text: Now when they heard this they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, "Brothers, what shall we do?"

verses.name: Acts 2:38
verses.text: And Peter said to them, "Repent and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Acts 2:39
verses.text: For the promise is for you and for your children and for all who are far off, everyone whom the Lord our God calls to himself."

verses.name: Acts 2:40
verses.text: And with many other words he bore witness and continued to exhort them, saying, "Save yourselves from this crooked generation."

verses.name: Acts 2:41
verses.text: So those who received his word were baptized, and there were added that day about three thousand souls.

verses.name: Acts 2:42
verses.text: And they devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching and fellowship, to the breaking of bread and the prayers.

verses.name: Acts 2:43
verses.text: And awe came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were being done through the apostles.

verses.name: Acts 2:44
verses.text: And all who believed were together and had all things in common.

verses.name: Acts 2:45
verses.text: And they were selling their possessions and belongings and distributing the proceeds to all, as any had need.

verses.name: Acts 2:46
verses.text: And day by day, attending the temple together and breaking bread in their homes, they received their food with glad and generous hearts,

verses.name: Acts 2:47
verses.text: praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to their number day by day those who were being saved.

verses.name: Acts 3:1
verses.text: Now Peter and John were going up to the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.

verses.name: Acts 3:2
verses.text: And a man lame from birth was being carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple that is called the Beautiful Gate to ask alms of those entering the temple.

verses.name: Acts 3:3
verses.text: Seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, he asked to receive alms.

verses.name: Acts 3:4
verses.text: And Peter directed his gaze at him, as did John, and said, "Look at us."

verses.name: Acts 3:5
verses.text: And he fixed his attention on them, expecting to receive something from them.

verses.name: Acts 3:6
verses.text: But Peter said, "I have no silver and gold, but what I do have I give to you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, rise up and walk!"

verses.name: Acts 3:7
verses.text: And he took him by the right hand and raised him up, and immediately his feet and ankles were made strong.

verses.name: Acts 3:8
verses.text: And leaping up he stood and began to walk, and entered the temple with them, walking and leaping and praising God.

verses.name: Acts 3:9
verses.text: And all the people saw him walking and praising God,

verses.name: Acts 3:10
verses.text: and recognized him as the one who sat at the Beautiful Gate of the temple, asking for alms. And they were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.

verses.name: Acts 3:11
verses.text: While he clung to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the portico called Solomon's, astounded.

verses.name: Acts 3:12
verses.text: And when Peter saw it he addressed the people: "Men of Israel, why do you wonder at this, or why do you stare at us, as though by our own power or piety we have made him walk?

verses.name: Acts 3:13
verses.text: The God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, the God of our fathers, glorified his servant Jesus, whom you delivered over and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he had decided to release him.

verses.name: Acts 3:14
verses.text: But you denied the Holy and Righteous One, and asked for a murderer to be granted to you,

verses.name: Acts 3:15
verses.text: and you killed the Author of life, whom God raised from the dead. To this we are witnesses.

verses.name: Acts 3:16
verses.text: And his name- by faith in his name- has made this man strong whom you see and know, and the faith that is through Jesus has given the man this perfect health in the presence of you all.

verses.name: Acts 3:17
verses.text: "And now, brothers, I know that you acted in ignorance, as did also your rulers.

verses.name: Acts 3:18
verses.text: But what God foretold by the mouth of all the prophets, that his Christ would suffer, he thus fulfilled.

verses.name: Acts 3:19
verses.text: Repent therefore, and turn again, that your sins may be blotted out,

verses.name: Acts 3:20
verses.text: that times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord, and that he may send the Christ appointed for you, Jesus,

verses.name: Acts 3:21
verses.text: whom heaven must receive until the time for restoring all the things about which God spoke by the mouth of his holy prophets long ago.

verses.name: Acts 3:22
verses.text: Moses said, 'The Lord God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your brothers. You shall listen to him in whatever he tells you.

verses.name: Acts 3:23
verses.text: And it shall be that every soul who does not listen to that prophet shall be destroyed from the people.'

verses.name: Acts 3:24
verses.text: And all the prophets who have spoken, from Samuel and those who came after him, also proclaimed these days.

verses.name: Acts 3:25
verses.text: You are the sons of the prophets and of the covenant that God made with your fathers, saying to Abraham, 'And in your offspring shall all the families of the earth be blessed.'

verses.name: Acts 3:26
verses.text: God, having raised up his servant, sent him to you first, to bless you by turning every one of you from your wickedness."

verses.name: Acts 4:1
verses.text: And as they were speaking to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees came upon them,

verses.name: Acts 4:2
verses.text: greatly annoyed because they were teaching the people and proclaiming in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.

verses.name: Acts 4:3
verses.text: And they arrested them and put them in custody until the next day, for it was already evening.

verses.name: Acts 4:4
verses.text: But many of those who had heard the word believed, and the number of the men came to about five thousand.

verses.name: Acts 4:5
verses.text: On the next day their rulers and elders and scribes gathered together in Jerusalem,

verses.name: Acts 4:6
verses.text: with Annas the high priest and Caiaphas and John and Alexander, and all who were of the high-priestly family.

verses.name: Acts 4:7
verses.text: And when they had set them in the midst, they inquired, "By what power or by what name did you do this?"

verses.name: Acts 4:8
verses.text: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, "Rulers of the people and elders,

verses.name: Acts 4:9
verses.text: if we are being examined today concerning a good deed done to a crippled man, by what means this man has been healed,

verses.name: Acts 4:10
verses.text: let it be known to all of you and to all the people of Israel that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead- by him this man is standing before you well.

verses.name: Acts 4:11
verses.text: This Jesus is the stone that was rejected by you, the builders, which has become the cornerstone.

verses.name: Acts 4:12
verses.text: And there is salvation in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given among men by which we must be saved."

verses.name: Acts 4:13
verses.text: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and perceived that they were uneducated, common men, they were astonished. And they recognized that they had been with Jesus.

verses.name: Acts 4:14
verses.text: But seeing the man who was healed standing beside them, they had nothing to say in opposition.

verses.name: Acts 4:15
verses.text: But when they had commanded them to leave the council, they conferred with one another,

verses.name: Acts 4:16
verses.text: saying, "What shall we do with these men? For that a notable sign has been performed through them is evident to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and we cannot deny it.

verses.name: Acts 4:17
verses.text: But in order that it may spread no further among the people, let us warn them to speak no more to anyone in this name."

verses.name: Acts 4:18
verses.text: So they called them and charged them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.

verses.name: Acts 4:19
verses.text: But Peter and John answered them, "Whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you rather than to God, you must judge,

verses.name: Acts 4:20
verses.text: for we cannot but speak of what we have seen and heard."

verses.name: Acts 4:21
verses.text: And when they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding no way to punish them, because of the people, for all were praising God for what had happened.

verses.name: Acts 4:22
verses.text: For the man on whom this sign of healing was performed was more than forty years old.

verses.name: Acts 4:23
verses.text: When they were released, they went to their friends and reported what the chief priests and the elders had said to them.

verses.name: Acts 4:24
verses.text: And when they heard it, they lifted their voices together to God and said, "Sovereign Lord, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and everything in them,

verses.name: Acts 4:25
verses.text: who through the mouth of our father David, your servant, said by the Holy Spirit, "' Why did the Gentiles rage, and the peoples plot in vain?

verses.name: Acts 4:26
verses.text: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers were gathered together, against the Lord and against his Anointed'-

verses.name: Acts 4:27
verses.text: for truly in this city there were gathered together against your holy servant Jesus, whom you anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, along with the Gentiles and the peoples of Israel,

verses.name: Acts 4:28
verses.text: to do whatever your hand and your plan had predestined to take place.

verses.name: Acts 4:29
verses.text: And now, Lord, look upon their threats and grant to your servants to continue to speak your word with all boldness,

verses.name: Acts 4:30
verses.text: while you stretch out your hand to heal, and signs and wonders are performed through the name of your holy servant Jesus."

verses.name: Acts 4:31
verses.text: And when they had prayed, the place in which they were gathered together was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and continued to speak the word of God with boldness.

verses.name: Acts 4:32
verses.text: Now the full number of those who believed were of one heart and soul, and no one said that any of the things that belonged to him was his own, but they had everything in common.

verses.name: Acts 4:33
verses.text: And with great power the apostles were giving their testimony to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus, and great grace was upon them all.

verses.name: Acts 4:34
verses.text: There was not a needy person among them, for as many as were owners of lands or houses sold them and brought the proceeds of what was sold

verses.name: Acts 4:35
verses.text: and laid it at the apostles' feet, and it was distributed to each as any had need.

verses.name: Acts 4:36
verses.text: Thus Joseph, who was also called by the apostles Barnabas (which means son of encouragement), a Levite, a native of Cyprus,

verses.name: Acts 4:37
verses.text: sold a field that belonged to him and brought the money and laid it at the apostles' feet.

verses.name: Acts 5:1
verses.text: But a man named Ananias, with his wife Sapphira, sold a piece of property,

verses.name: Acts 5:2
verses.text: and with his wife's knowledge he kept back for himself some of the proceeds and brought only a part of it and laid it at the apostles' feet.

verses.name: Acts 5:3
verses.text: But Peter said, "Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit and to keep back for yourself part of the proceeds of the land?

verses.name: Acts 5:4
verses.text: While it remained unsold, did it not remain your own? And after it was sold, was it not at your disposal? Why is it that you have contrived this deed in your heart? You have not lied to men but to God."

verses.name: Acts 5:5
verses.text: When Ananias heard these words, he fell down and breathed his last. And great fear came upon all who heard of it.

verses.name: Acts 5:6
verses.text: The young men rose and wrapped him up and carried him out and buried him.

verses.name: Acts 5:7
verses.text: After an interval of about three hours his wife came in, not knowing what had happened.

verses.name: Acts 5:8
verses.text: And Peter said to her, "Tell me whether you sold the land for so much." And she said, "Yes, for so much."

verses.name: Acts 5:9
verses.text: But Peter said to her, "How is it that you have agreed together to test the Spirit of the Lord? Behold, the feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out."

verses.name: Acts 5:10
verses.text: Immediately she fell down at his feet and breathed her last. When the young men came in they found her dead, and they carried her out and buried her beside her husband.

verses.name: Acts 5:11
verses.text: And great fear came upon the whole church and upon all who heard of these things.

verses.name: Acts 5:12
verses.text: Now many signs and wonders were regularly done among the people by the hands of the apostles. And they were all together in Solomon's Portico.

verses.name: Acts 5:13
verses.text: None of the rest dared join them, but the people held them in high esteem.

verses.name: Acts 5:14
verses.text: And more than ever believers were added to the Lord, multitudes of both men and women,

verses.name: Acts 5:15
verses.text: so that they even carried out the sick into the streets and laid them on cots and mats, that as Peter came by at least his shadow might fall on some of them.

verses.name: Acts 5:16
verses.text: The people also gathered from the towns around Jerusalem, bringing the sick and those afflicted with unclean spirits, and they were all healed.

verses.name: Acts 5:17
verses.text: But the high priest rose up, and all who were with him (that is, the party of the Sadducees), and filled with jealousy

verses.name: Acts 5:18
verses.text: they arrested the apostles and put them in the public prison.

verses.name: Acts 5:19
verses.text: But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors and brought them out, and said,

verses.name: Acts 5:20
verses.text: "Go and stand in the temple and speak to the people all the words of this Life."

verses.name: Acts 5:21
verses.text: And when they heard this, they entered the temple at daybreak and began to teach. Now when the high priest came, and those who were with him, they called together the council and all the senate of Israel and sent to the prison to have them brought.

verses.name: Acts 5:22
verses.text: But when the officers came, they did not find them in the prison, so they returned and reported,

verses.name: Acts 5:23
verses.text: "We found the prison securely locked and the guards standing at the doors, but when we opened them we found no one inside."

verses.name: Acts 5:24
verses.text: Now when the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these words, they were greatly perplexed about them, wondering what this would come to.

verses.name: Acts 5:25
verses.text: And someone came and told them, "Look! The men whom you put in prison are standing in the temple and teaching the people."

verses.name: Acts 5:26
verses.text: Then the captain with the officers went and brought them, but not by force, for they were afraid of being stoned by the people.

verses.name: Acts 5:27
verses.text: And when they had brought them, they set them before the council. And the high priest questioned them,

verses.name: Acts 5:28
verses.text: saying, "We strictly charged you not to teach in this name, yet here you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and you intend to bring this man's blood upon us."

verses.name: Acts 5:29
verses.text: But Peter and the apostles answered, "We must obey God rather than men.

verses.name: Acts 5:30
verses.text: The God of our fathers raised Jesus, whom you killed by hanging him on a tree.

verses.name: Acts 5:31
verses.text: God exalted him at his right hand as Leader and Savior, to give repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins.

verses.name: Acts 5:32
verses.text: And we are witnesses to these things, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him."

verses.name: Acts 5:33
verses.text: When they heard this, they were enraged and wanted to kill them.

verses.name: Acts 5:34
verses.text: But a Pharisee in the council named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law held in honor by all the people, stood up and gave orders to put the men outside for a little while.

verses.name: Acts 5:35
verses.text: And he said to them, "Men of Israel, take care what you are about to do with these men.

verses.name: Acts 5:36
verses.text: For before these days Theudas rose up, claiming to be somebody, and a number of men, about four hundred, joined him. He was killed, and all who followed him were dispersed and came to nothing.

verses.name: Acts 5:37
verses.text: After him Judas the Galilean rose up in the days of the census and drew away some of the people after him. He too perished, and all who followed him were scattered.

verses.name: Acts 5:38
verses.text: So in the present case I tell you, keep away from these men and let them alone, for if this plan or this undertaking is of man, it will fail;

verses.name: Acts 5:39
verses.text: but if it is of God, you will not be able to overthrow them. You might even be found opposing God!" So they took his advice,

verses.name: Acts 5:40
verses.text: and when they had called in the apostles, they beat them and charged them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.

verses.name: Acts 5:41
verses.text: Then they left the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonor for the name.

verses.name: Acts 5:42
verses.text: And every day, in the temple and from house to house, they did not cease teaching and preaching Jesus as the Christ.

verses.name: Acts 6:1
verses.text: Now in these days when the disciples were increasing in number, a complaint by the Hellenists arose against the Hebrews because their widows were being neglected in the daily distribution.

verses.name: Acts 6:2
verses.text: And the twelve summoned the full number of the disciples and said, "It is not right that we should give up preaching the word of God to serve tables.

verses.name: Acts 6:3
verses.text: Therefore, brothers, pick out from among you seven men of good repute, full of the Spirit and of wisdom, whom we will appoint to this duty.

verses.name: Acts 6:4
verses.text: But we will devote ourselves to prayer and to the ministry of the word."

verses.name: Acts 6:5
verses.text: And what they said pleased the whole gathering, and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolaus, a proselyte of Antioch.

verses.name: Acts 6:6
verses.text: These they set before the apostles, and they prayed and laid their hands on them.

verses.name: Acts 6:7
verses.text: And the word of God continued to increase, and the number of the disciples multiplied greatly in Jerusalem, and a great many of the priests became obedient to the faith.

verses.name: Acts 6:8
verses.text: And Stephen, full of grace and power, was doing great wonders and signs among the people.

verses.name: Acts 6:9
verses.text: Then some of those who belonged to the synagogue of the Freedmen (as it was called), and of the Cyrenians, and of the Alexandrians, and of those from Cilicia and Asia, rose up and disputed with Stephen.

verses.name: Acts 6:10
verses.text: But they could not withstand the wisdom and the Spirit with which he was speaking.

verses.name: Acts 6:11
verses.text: Then they secretly instigated men who said, "We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God."

verses.name: Acts 6:12
verses.text: And they stirred up the people and the elders and the scribes, and they came upon him and seized him and brought him before the council,

verses.name: Acts 6:13
verses.text: and they set up false witnesses who said, "This man never ceases to speak words against this holy place and the law,

verses.name: Acts 6:14
verses.text: for we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place and will change the customs that Moses delivered to us."

verses.name: Acts 6:15
verses.text: And gazing at him, all who sat in the council saw that his face was like the face of an angel.

verses.name: Acts 7:1
verses.text: And the high priest said, "Are these things so?"

verses.name: Acts 7:2
verses.text: And Stephen said: "Brothers and fathers, hear me. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran,

verses.name: Acts 7:3
verses.text: and said to him, 'Go out from your land and from your kindred and go into the land that I will show you.'

verses.name: Acts 7:4
verses.text: Then he went out from the land of the Chaldeans and lived in Haran. And after his father died, God removed him from there into this land in which you are now living.

verses.name: Acts 7:5
verses.text: Yet he gave him no inheritance in it, not even a foot's length, but promised to give it to him as a possession and to his offspring after him, though he had no child.

verses.name: Acts 7:6
verses.text: And God spoke to this effect- that his offspring would be sojourners in a land belonging to others, who would enslave them and afflict them four hundred years.

verses.name: Acts 7:7
verses.text: 'But I will judge the nation that they serve,' said God, 'and after that they shall come out and worship me in this place.'

verses.name: Acts 7:8
verses.text: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision. And so Abraham became the father of Isaac, and circumcised him on the eighth day, and Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob of the twelve patriarchs.

verses.name: Acts 7:9
verses.text: "And the patriarchs, jealous of Joseph, sold him into Egypt; but God was with him

verses.name: Acts 7:10
verses.text: and rescued him out of all his afflictions and gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh, king of Egypt, who made him ruler over Egypt and over all his household.

verses.name: Acts 7:11
verses.text: Now there came a famine throughout all Egypt and Canaan, and great affliction, and our fathers could find no food.

verses.name: Acts 7:12
verses.text: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent out our fathers on their first visit.

verses.name: Acts 7:13
verses.text: And on the second visit Joseph made himself known to his brothers, and Joseph's family became known to Pharaoh.

verses.name: Acts 7:14
verses.text: And Joseph sent and summoned Jacob his father and all his kindred, seventy-five persons in all.

verses.name: Acts 7:15
verses.text: And Jacob went down into Egypt, and he died, he and our fathers,

verses.name: Acts 7:16
verses.text: and they were carried back to Shechem and laid in the tomb that Abraham had bought for a sum of silver from the sons of Hamor in Shechem.

verses.name: Acts 7:17
verses.text: "But as the time of the promise drew near, which God had granted to Abraham, the people increased and multiplied in Egypt

verses.name: Acts 7:18
verses.text: until there arose over Egypt another king who did not know Joseph.

verses.name: Acts 7:19
verses.text: He dealt shrewdly with our race and forced our fathers to expose their infants, so that they would not be kept alive.

verses.name: Acts 7:20
verses.text: At this time Moses was born; and he was beautiful in God's sight. And he was brought up for three months in his father's house,

verses.name: Acts 7:21
verses.text: and when he was exposed, Pharaoh's daughter adopted him and brought him up as her own son.

verses.name: Acts 7:22
verses.text: And Moses was instructed in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and he was mighty in his words and deeds.

verses.name: Acts 7:23
verses.text: "When he was forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brothers, the children of Israel.

verses.name: Acts 7:24
verses.text: And seeing one of them being wronged, he defended the oppressed man and avenged him by striking down the Egyptian.

verses.name: Acts 7:25
verses.text: He supposed that his brothers would understand that God was giving them salvation by his hand, but they did not understand.

verses.name: Acts 7:26
verses.text: And on the following day he appeared to them as they were quarreling and tried to reconcile them, saying, 'Men, you are brothers. Why do you wrong each other?'

verses.name: Acts 7:27
verses.text: But the man who was wronging his neighbor thrust him aside, saying, 'Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?

verses.name: Acts 7:28
verses.text: Do you want to kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?'

verses.name: Acts 7:29
verses.text: At this retort Moses fled and became an exile in the land of Midian, where he became the father of two sons.

verses.name: Acts 7:30
verses.text: "Now when forty years had passed, an angel appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush.

verses.name: Acts 7:31
verses.text: When Moses saw it, he was amazed at the sight, and as he drew near to look, there came the voice of the Lord:

verses.name: Acts 7:32
verses.text: 'I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham and of Isaac and of Jacob.' And Moses trembled and did not dare to look.

verses.name: Acts 7:33
verses.text: Then the Lord said to him, 'Take off the sandals from your feet, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.

verses.name: Acts 7:34
verses.text: I have surely seen the affliction of my people who are in Egypt, and have heard their groaning, and I have come down to deliver them. And now come, I will send you to Egypt.'

verses.name: Acts 7:35
verses.text: "This Moses, whom they rejected, saying, 'Who made you a ruler and a judge?'- this man God sent as both ruler and redeemer by the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.

verses.name: Acts 7:36
verses.text: This man led them out, performing wonders and signs in Egypt and at the Red Sea and in the wilderness for forty years.

verses.name: Acts 7:37
verses.text: This is the Moses who said to the Israelites, 'God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your brothers.'

verses.name: Acts 7:38
verses.text: This is the one who was in the congregation in the wilderness with the angel who spoke to him at Mount Sinai, and with our fathers. He received living oracles to give to us.

verses.name: Acts 7:39
verses.text: Our fathers refused to obey him, but thrust him aside, and in their hearts they turned to Egypt,

verses.name: Acts 7:40
verses.text: saying to Aaron, 'Make for us gods who will go before us. As for this Moses who led us out from the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.'

verses.name: Acts 7:41
verses.text: And they made a calf in those days, and offered a sacrifice to the idol and were rejoicing in the works of their hands.

verses.name: Acts 7:42
verses.text: But God turned away and gave them over to worship the host of heaven, as it is written in the book of the prophets: "' Did you bring to me slain beasts and sacrifices, during the forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?

verses.name: Acts 7:43
verses.text: You took up the tent of Moloch and the star of your god Rephan, the images that you made to worship; and I will send you into exile beyond Babylon.'

verses.name: Acts 7:44
verses.text: "Our fathers had the tent of witness in the wilderness, just as he who spoke to Moses directed him to make it, according to the pattern that he had seen.

verses.name: Acts 7:45
verses.text: Our fathers in turn brought it in with Joshua when they dispossessed the nations that God drove out before our fathers. So it was until the days of David,

verses.name: Acts 7:46
verses.text: who found favor in the sight of God and asked to find a dwelling place for the God of Jacob.

verses.name: Acts 7:47
verses.text: But it was Solomon who built a house for him.

verses.name: Acts 7:48
verses.text: Yet the Most High does not dwell in houses made by hands, as the prophet says,

verses.name: Acts 7:49
verses.text: "'Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool. What kind of house will you build for me, says the Lord, or what is the place of my rest?

verses.name: Acts 7:50
verses.text: Did not my hand make all these things?'

verses.name: Acts 7:51
verses.text: "You stiff-necked people, uncircumcised in heart and ears, you always resist the Holy Spirit. As your fathers did, so do you.

verses.name: Acts 7:52
verses.text: Which of the prophets did not your fathers persecute? And they killed those who announced beforehand the coming of the Righteous One, whom you have now betrayed and murdered,

verses.name: Acts 7:53
verses.text: you who received the law as delivered by angels and did not keep it."

verses.name: Acts 7:54
verses.text: Now when they heard these things they were enraged, and they ground their teeth at him.

verses.name: Acts 7:55
verses.text: But he, full of the Holy Spirit, gazed into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God.

verses.name: Acts 7:56
verses.text: And he said, "Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God."

verses.name: Acts 7:57
verses.text: But they cried out with a loud voice and stopped their ears and rushed together at him.

verses.name: Acts 7:58
verses.text: Then they cast him out of the city and stoned him. And the witnesses laid down their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul.

verses.name: Acts 7:59
verses.text: And as they were stoning Stephen, he called out, "Lord Jesus, receive my spirit."

verses.name: Acts 7:60
verses.text: And falling to his knees he cried out with a loud voice, "Lord, do not hold this sin against them." And when he had said this, he fell asleep.

verses.name: Acts 8:1
verses.text: And Saul approved of his execution. And there arose on that day a great persecution against the church in Jerusalem, and they were all scattered throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except the apostles.

verses.name: Acts 8:2
verses.text: Devout men buried Stephen and made great lamentation over him.

verses.name: Acts 8:3
verses.text: But Saul was ravaging the church, and entering house after house, he dragged off men and women and committed them to prison.

verses.name: Acts 8:4
verses.text: Now those who were scattered went about preaching the word.

verses.name: Acts 8:5
verses.text: Philip went down to the city of Samaria and proclaimed to them the Christ.

verses.name: Acts 8:6
verses.text: And the crowds with one accord paid attention to what was being said by Philip when they heard him and saw the signs that he did.

verses.name: Acts 8:7
verses.text: For unclean spirits came out of many who were possessed, crying with a loud voice, and many who were paralyzed or lame were healed.

verses.name: Acts 8:8
verses.text: So there was much joy in that city.

verses.name: Acts 8:9
verses.text: But there was a man named Simon, who had previously practiced magic in the city and amazed the people of Samaria, saying that he himself was somebody great.

verses.name: Acts 8:10
verses.text: They all paid attention to him, from the least to the greatest, saying, "This man is the power of God that is called Great."

verses.name: Acts 8:11
verses.text: And they paid attention to him because for a long time he had amazed them with his magic.

verses.name: Acts 8:12
verses.text: But when they believed Philip as he preached good news about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

verses.name: Acts 8:13
verses.text: Even Simon himself believed, and after being baptized he continued with Philip. And seeing signs and great miracles performed, he was amazed.

verses.name: Acts 8:14
verses.text: Now when the apostles at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent to them Peter and John,

verses.name: Acts 8:15
verses.text: who came down and prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Spirit,

verses.name: Acts 8:16
verses.text: for he had not yet fallen on any of them, but they had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

verses.name: Acts 8:17
verses.text: Then they laid their hands on them and they received the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Acts 8:18
verses.text: Now when Simon saw that the Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles' hands, he offered them money,

verses.name: Acts 8:19
verses.text: saying, "Give me this power also, so that anyone on whom I lay my hands may receive the Holy Spirit."

verses.name: Acts 8:20
verses.text: But Peter said to him, "May your silver perish with you, because you thought you could obtain the gift of God with money!

verses.name: Acts 8:21
verses.text: You have neither part nor lot in this matter, for your heart is not right before God.

verses.name: Acts 8:22
verses.text: Repent, therefore, of this wickedness of yours, and pray to the Lord that, if possible, the intent of your heart may be forgiven you.

verses.name: Acts 8:23
verses.text: For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and in the bond of iniquity."

verses.name: Acts 8:24
verses.text: And Simon answered, "Pray for me to the Lord, that nothing of what you have said may come upon me."

verses.name: Acts 8:25
verses.text: Now when they had testified and spoken the word of the Lord, they returned to Jerusalem, preaching the gospel to many villages of the Samaritans.

verses.name: Acts 8:26
verses.text: Now an angel of the Lord said to Philip, "Rise and go toward the south to the road that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza." This is a desert place.

verses.name: Acts 8:27
verses.text: And he rose and went. And there was an Ethiopian, a eunuch, a court official of Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was in charge of all her treasure. He had come to Jerusalem to worship

verses.name: Acts 8:28
verses.text: and was returning, seated in his chariot, and he was reading the prophet Isaiah.

verses.name: Acts 8:29
verses.text: And the Spirit said to Philip, "Go over and join this chariot."

verses.name: Acts 8:30
verses.text: So Philip ran to him and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet and asked, "Do you understand what you are reading?"

verses.name: Acts 8:31
verses.text: And he said, "How can I, unless someone guides me?" And he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.

verses.name: Acts 8:32
verses.text: Now the passage of the Scripture that he was reading was this: "Like a sheep he was led to the slaughter and like a lamb before its shearer is silent, so he opens not his mouth.

verses.name: Acts 8:33
verses.text: In his humiliation justice was denied him. Who can describe his generation? For his life is taken away from the earth."

verses.name: Acts 8:34
verses.text: And the eunuch said to Philip, "About whom, I ask you, does the prophet say this, about himself or about someone else?"

verses.name: Acts 8:35
verses.text: Then Philip opened his mouth, and beginning with this Scripture he told him the good news about Jesus.

verses.name: Acts 8:36
verses.text: And as they were going along the road they came to some water, and the eunuch said, "See, here is water! What prevents me from being baptized?"

verses.name: Acts 8:38
verses.text: And he commanded the chariot to stop, and they both went down into the water, Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.

verses.name: Acts 8:39
verses.text: And when they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord carried Philip away, and the eunuch saw him no more, and went on his way rejoicing.

verses.name: Acts 8:40
verses.text: But Philip found himself at Azotus, and as he passed through he preached the gospel to all the towns until he came to Caesarea.

verses.name: Acts 9:1
verses.text: But Saul, still breathing threats and murder against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest

verses.name: Acts 9:2
verses.text: and asked him for letters to the synagogues at Damascus, so that if he found any belonging to the Way, men or women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.

verses.name: Acts 9:3
verses.text: Now as he went on his way, he approached Damascus, and suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him.

verses.name: Acts 9:4
verses.text: And falling to the ground he heard a voice saying to him, "Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?"

verses.name: Acts 9:5
verses.text: And he said, "Who are you, Lord?" And he said, "I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting.

verses.name: Acts 9:6
verses.text: But rise and enter the city, and you will be told what you are to do."

verses.name: Acts 9:7
verses.text: The men who were traveling with him stood speechless, hearing the voice but seeing no one.

verses.name: Acts 9:8
verses.text: Saul rose from the ground, and although his eyes were opened, he saw nothing. So they led him by the hand and brought him into Damascus.

verses.name: Acts 9:9
verses.text: And for three days he was without sight, and neither ate nor drank.

verses.name: Acts 9:10
verses.text: Now there was a disciple at Damascus named Ananias. The Lord said to him in a vision, "Ananias." And he said, "Here I am, Lord."

verses.name: Acts 9:11
verses.text: And the Lord said to him, "Rise and go to the street called Straight, and at the house of Judas look for a man of Tarsus named Saul, for behold, he is praying,

verses.name: Acts 9:12
verses.text: and he has seen in a vision a man named Ananias come in and lay his hands on him so that he might regain his sight."

verses.name: Acts 9:13
verses.text: But Ananias answered, "Lord, I have heard from many about this man, how much evil he has done to your saints at Jerusalem.

verses.name: Acts 9:14
verses.text: And here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who call on your name."

verses.name: Acts 9:15
verses.text: But the Lord said to him, "Go, for he is a chosen instrument of mine to carry my name before the Gentiles and kings and the children of Israel.

verses.name: Acts 9:16
verses.text: For I will show him how much he must suffer for the sake of my name."

verses.name: Acts 9:17
verses.text: So Ananias departed and entered the house. And laying his hands on him he said, "Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus who appeared to you on the road by which you came has sent me so that you may regain your sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit."

verses.name: Acts 9:18
verses.text: And immediately something like scales fell from his eyes, and he regained his sight. Then he rose and was baptized;

verses.name: Acts 9:19
verses.text: and taking food, he was strengthened. For some days he was with the disciples at Damascus.

verses.name: Acts 9:20
verses.text: And immediately he proclaimed Jesus in the synagogues, saying, "He is the Son of God."

verses.name: Acts 9:21
verses.text: And all who heard him were amazed and said, "Is not this the man who made havoc in Jerusalem of those who called upon this name? And has he not come here for this purpose, to bring them bound before the chief priests?"

verses.name: Acts 9:22
verses.text: But Saul increased all the more in strength, and confounded the Jews who lived in Damascus by proving that Jesus was the Christ.

verses.name: Acts 9:23
verses.text: When many days had passed, the Jews plotted to kill him,

verses.name: Acts 9:24
verses.text: but their plot became known to Saul. They were watching the gates day and night in order to kill him,

verses.name: Acts 9:25
verses.text: but his disciples took him by night and let him down through an opening in the wall, lowering him in a basket.

verses.name: Acts 9:26
verses.text: And when he had come to Jerusalem, he attempted to join the disciples. And they were all afraid of him, for they did not believe that he was a disciple.

verses.name: Acts 9:27
verses.text: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles and declared to them how on the road he had seen the Lord, who spoke to him, and how at Damascus he had preached boldly in the name of Jesus.

verses.name: Acts 9:28
verses.text: So he went in and out among them at Jerusalem, preaching boldly in the name of the Lord.

verses.name: Acts 9:29
verses.text: And he spoke and disputed against the Hellenists. But they were seeking to kill him.

verses.name: Acts 9:30
verses.text: And when the brothers learned this, they brought him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus.

verses.name: Acts 9:31
verses.text: So the church throughout all Judea and Galilee and Samaria had peace and was being built up. And walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, it multiplied.

verses.name: Acts 9:32
verses.text: Now as Peter went here and there among them all, he came down also to the saints who lived at Lydda.

verses.name: Acts 9:33
verses.text: There he found a man named Aeneas, bedridden for eight years, who was paralyzed.

verses.name: Acts 9:34
verses.text: And Peter said to him, "Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you; rise and make your bed." And immediately he rose.

verses.name: Acts 9:35
verses.text: And all the residents of Lydda and Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.

verses.name: Acts 9:36
verses.text: Now there was in Joppa a disciple named Tabitha, which, translated, means Dorcas. She was full of good works and acts of charity.

verses.name: Acts 9:37
verses.text: In those days she became ill and died, and when they had washed her, they laid her in an upper room.

verses.name: Acts 9:38
verses.text: Since Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples, hearing that Peter was there, sent two men to him, urging him, "Please come to us without delay."

verses.name: Acts 9:39
verses.text: So Peter rose and went with them. And when he arrived, they took him to the upper room. All the widows stood beside him weeping and showing tunics and other garments that Dorcas made while she was with them.

verses.name: Acts 9:40
verses.text: But Peter put them all outside, and knelt down and prayed; and turning to the body he said, "Tabitha, arise." And she opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter she sat up.

verses.name: Acts 9:41
verses.text: And he gave her his hand and raised her up. Then calling the saints and widows, he presented her alive.

verses.name: Acts 9:42
verses.text: And it became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.

verses.name: Acts 9:43
verses.text: And he stayed in Joppa for many days with one Simon, a tanner.

verses.name: Acts 10:1
verses.text: At Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius, a centurion of what was known as the Italian Cohort,

verses.name: Acts 10:2
verses.text: a devout man who feared God with all his household, gave alms generously to the people, and prayed continually to God.

verses.name: Acts 10:3
verses.text: About the ninth hour of the day he saw clearly in a vision an angel of God come in and say to him, "Cornelius."

verses.name: Acts 10:4
verses.text: And he stared at him in terror and said, "What is it, Lord?" And he said to him, "Your prayers and your alms have ascended as a memorial before God.

verses.name: Acts 10:5
verses.text: And now send men to Joppa and bring one Simon who is called Peter.

verses.name: Acts 10:6
verses.text: He is lodging with one Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the seaside."

verses.name: Acts 10:7
verses.text: When the angel who spoke to him had departed, he called two of his servants and a devout soldier from among those who attended him,

verses.name: Acts 10:8
verses.text: and having related everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.

verses.name: Acts 10:9
verses.text: The next day, as they were on their journey and approaching the city, Peter went up on the housetop about the sixth hour to pray.

verses.name: Acts 10:10
verses.text: And he became hungry and wanted something to eat, but while they were preparing it, he fell into a trance

verses.name: Acts 10:11
verses.text: and saw the heavens opened and something like a great sheet descending, being let down by its four corners upon the earth.

verses.name: Acts 10:12
verses.text: In it were all kinds of animals and reptiles and birds of the air.

verses.name: Acts 10:13
verses.text: And there came a voice to him: "Rise, Peter; kill and eat."

verses.name: Acts 10:14
verses.text: But Peter said, "By no means, Lord; for I have never eaten anything that is common or unclean."

verses.name: Acts 10:15
verses.text: And the voice came to him again a second time, "What God has made clean, do not call common."

verses.name: Acts 10:16
verses.text: This happened three times, and the thing was taken up at once to heaven.

verses.name: Acts 10:17
verses.text: Now while Peter was inwardly perplexed as to what the vision that he had seen might mean, behold, the men who were sent by Cornelius, having made inquiry for Simon's house, stood at the gate

verses.name: Acts 10:18
verses.text: and called out to ask whether Simon who was called Peter was lodging there.

verses.name: Acts 10:19
verses.text: And while Peter was pondering the vision, the Spirit said to him, "Behold, three men are looking for you.

verses.name: Acts 10:20
verses.text: Rise and go down and accompany them without hesitation, for I have sent them."

verses.name: Acts 10:21
verses.text: And Peter went down to the men and said, "I am the one you are looking for. What is the reason for your coming?"

verses.name: Acts 10:22
verses.text: And they said, "Cornelius, a centurion, an upright and God-fearing man, who is well spoken of by the whole Jewish nation, was directed by a holy angel to send for you to come to his house and to hear what you have to say."

verses.name: Acts 10:23
verses.text: So he invited them in to be his guests. The next day he rose and went away with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa accompanied him.

verses.name: Acts 10:24
verses.text: And on the following day they entered Caesarea. Cornelius was expecting them and had called together his relatives and close friends.

verses.name: Acts 10:25
verses.text: When Peter entered, Cornelius met him and fell down at his feet and worshiped him.

verses.name: Acts 10:26
verses.text: But Peter lifted him up, saying, "Stand up; I too am a man."

verses.name: Acts 10:27
verses.text: And as he talked with him, he went in and found many persons gathered.

verses.name: Acts 10:28
verses.text: And he said to them, "You yourselves know how unlawful it is for a Jew to associate with or to visit anyone of another nation, but God has shown me that I should not call any person common or unclean.

verses.name: Acts 10:29
verses.text: So when I was sent for, I came without objection. I ask then why you sent for me."

verses.name: Acts 10:30
verses.text: And Cornelius said, "Four days ago, about this hour, I was praying in my house at the ninth hour, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing

verses.name: Acts 10:31
verses.text: and said, 'Cornelius, your prayer has been heard and your alms have been remembered before God.

verses.name: Acts 10:32
verses.text: Send therefore to Joppa and ask for Simon who is called Peter. He is lodging in the house of Simon, a tanner, by the sea.'

verses.name: Acts 10:33
verses.text: So I sent for you at once, and you have been kind enough to come. Now therefore we are all here in the presence of God to hear all that you have been commanded by the Lord."

verses.name: Acts 10:34
verses.text: So Peter opened his mouth and said: "Truly I understand that God shows no partiality,

verses.name: Acts 10:35
verses.text: but in every nation anyone who fears him and does what is right is acceptable to him.

verses.name: Acts 10:36
verses.text: As for the word that he sent to Israel, preaching good news of peace through Jesus Christ (he is Lord of all),

verses.name: Acts 10:37
verses.text: you yourselves know what happened throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee after the baptism that John proclaimed:

verses.name: Acts 10:38
verses.text: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power. He went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with him.

verses.name: Acts 10:39
verses.text: And we are witnesses of all that he did both in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem. They put him to death by hanging him on a tree,

verses.name: Acts 10:40
verses.text: but God raised him on the third day and made him to appear,

verses.name: Acts 10:41
verses.text: not to all the people but to us who had been chosen by God as witnesses, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.

verses.name: Acts 10:42
verses.text: And he commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that he is the one appointed by God to be judge of the living and the dead.

verses.name: Acts 10:43
verses.text: To him all the prophets bear witness that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name."

verses.name: Acts 10:44
verses.text: While Peter was still saying these things, the Holy Spirit fell on all who heard the word.

verses.name: Acts 10:45
verses.text: And the believers from among the circumcised who had come with Peter were amazed, because the gift of the Holy Spirit was poured out even on the Gentiles.

verses.name: Acts 10:46
verses.text: For they were hearing them speaking in tongues and extolling God. Then Peter declared,

verses.name: Acts 10:47
verses.text: "Can anyone withhold water for baptizing these people, who have received the Holy Spirit just as we have?"

verses.name: Acts 10:48
verses.text: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to remain for some days.

verses.name: Acts 11:1
verses.text: Now the apostles and the brothers who were throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.

verses.name: Acts 11:2
verses.text: So when Peter went up to Jerusalem, the circumcision party criticized him, saying,

verses.name: Acts 11:3
verses.text: "You went to uncircumcised men and ate with them."

verses.name: Acts 11:4
verses.text: But Peter began and explained it to them in order:

verses.name: Acts 11:5
verses.text: "I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision, something like a great sheet descending, being let down from heaven by its four corners, and it came down to me.

verses.name: Acts 11:6
verses.text: Looking at it closely, I observed animals and beasts of prey and reptiles and birds of the air.

verses.name: Acts 11:7
verses.text: And I heard a voice saying to me, 'Rise, Peter; kill and eat.'

verses.name: Acts 11:8
verses.text: But I said, 'By no means, Lord; for nothing common or unclean has ever entered my mouth.'

verses.name: Acts 11:9
verses.text: But the voice answered a second time from heaven, 'What God has made clean, do not call common.'

verses.name: Acts 11:10
verses.text: This happened three times, and all was drawn up again into heaven.

verses.name: Acts 11:11
verses.text: And behold, at that very moment three men arrived at the house in which we were, sent to me from Caesarea.

verses.name: Acts 11:12
verses.text: And the Spirit told me to go with them, making no distinction. These six brothers also accompanied me, and we entered the man's house.

verses.name: Acts 11:13
verses.text: And he told us how he had seen the angel stand in his house and say, 'Send to Joppa and bring Simon who is called Peter;

verses.name: Acts 11:14
verses.text: he will declare to you a message by which you will be saved, you and all your household.'

verses.name: Acts 11:15
verses.text: As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them just as on us at the beginning.

verses.name: Acts 11:16
verses.text: And I remembered the word of the Lord, how he said, 'John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.'

verses.name: Acts 11:17
verses.text: If then God gave the same gift to them as he gave to us when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I that I could stand in God's way?"

verses.name: Acts 11:18
verses.text: When they heard these things they fell silent. And they glorified God, saying, "Then to the Gentiles also God has granted repentance that leads to life."

verses.name: Acts 11:19
verses.text: Now those who were scattered because of the persecution that arose over Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except Jews.

verses.name: Acts 11:20
verses.text: But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who on coming to Antioch spoke to the Hellenists also, preaching the Lord Jesus.

verses.name: Acts 11:21
verses.text: And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number who believed turned to the Lord.

verses.name: Acts 11:22
verses.text: The report of this came to the ears of the church in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas to Antioch.

verses.name: Acts 11:23
verses.text: When he came and saw the grace of God, he was glad, and he exhorted them all to remain faithful to the Lord with steadfast purpose,

verses.name: Acts 11:24
verses.text: for he was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and of faith. And a great many people were added to the Lord.

verses.name: Acts 11:25
verses.text: So Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul,

verses.name: Acts 11:26
verses.text: and when he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. For a whole year they met with the church and taught a great many people. And in Antioch the disciples were first called Christians.

verses.name: Acts 11:27
verses.text: Now in these days prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.

verses.name: Acts 11:28
verses.text: And one of them named Agabus stood up and foretold by the Spirit that there would be a great famine over all the world (this took place in the days of Claudius).

verses.name: Acts 11:29
verses.text: So the disciples determined, everyone according to his ability, to send relief to the brothers living in Judea.

verses.name: Acts 11:30
verses.text: And they did so, sending it to the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.

verses.name: Acts 12:1
verses.text: About that time Herod the king laid violent hands on some who belonged to the church.

verses.name: Acts 12:2
verses.text: He killed James the brother of John with the sword,

verses.name: Acts 12:3
verses.text: and when he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded to arrest Peter also. This was during the days of Unleavened Bread.

verses.name: Acts 12:4
verses.text: And when he had seized him, he put him in prison, delivering him over to four squads of soldiers to guard him, intending after the Passover to bring him out to the people.

verses.name: Acts 12:5
verses.text: So Peter was kept in prison, but earnest prayer for him was made to God by the church.

verses.name: Acts 12:6
verses.text: Now when Herod was about to bring him out, on that very night, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and sentries before the door were guarding the prison.

verses.name: Acts 12:7
verses.text: And behold, an angel of the Lord stood next to him, and a light shone in the cell. He struck Peter on the side and woke him, saying, "Get up quickly." And the chains fell off his hands.

verses.name: Acts 12:8
verses.text: And the angel said to him, "Dress yourself and put on your sandals." And he did so. And he said to him, "Wrap your cloak around you and follow me."

verses.name: Acts 12:9
verses.text: And he went out and followed him. He did not know that what was being done by the angel was real, but thought he was seeing a vision.

verses.name: Acts 12:10
verses.text: When they had passed the first and the second guard, they came to the iron gate leading into the city. It opened for them of its own accord, and they went out and went along one street, and immediately the angel left him.

verses.name: Acts 12:11
verses.text: When Peter came to himself, he said, "Now I am sure that the Lord has sent his angel and rescued me from the hand of Herod and from all that the Jewish people were expecting."

verses.name: Acts 12:12
verses.text: When he realized this, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John whose other name was Mark, where many were gathered together and were praying.

verses.name: Acts 12:13
verses.text: And when he knocked at the door of the gateway, a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer.

verses.name: Acts 12:14
verses.text: Recognizing Peter's voice, in her joy she did not open the gate but ran in and reported that Peter was standing at the gate.

verses.name: Acts 12:15
verses.text: They said to her, "You are out of your mind." But she kept insisting that it was so, and they kept saying, "It is his angel!"

verses.name: Acts 12:16
verses.text: But Peter continued knocking, and when they opened, they saw him and were amazed.

verses.name: Acts 12:17
verses.text: But motioning to them with his hand to be silent, he described to them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, "Tell these things to James and to the brothers." Then he departed and went to another place.

verses.name: Acts 12:18
verses.text: Now when day came, there was no little disturbance among the soldiers over what had become of Peter.

verses.name: Acts 12:19
verses.text: And after Herod searched for him and did not find him, he examined the sentries and ordered that they should be put to death. Then he went down from Judea to Caesarea and spent time there.

verses.name: Acts 12:20
verses.text: Now Herod was angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon, and they came to him with one accord, and having persuaded Blastus, the king's chamberlain, they asked for peace, because their country depended on the king's country for food.

verses.name: Acts 12:21
verses.text: On an appointed day Herod put on his royal robes, took his seat upon the throne, and delivered an oration to them.

verses.name: Acts 12:22
verses.text: And the people were shouting, "The voice of a god, and not of a man!"

verses.name: Acts 12:23
verses.text: Immediately an angel of the Lord struck him down, because he did not give God the glory, and he was eaten by worms and breathed his last.

verses.name: Acts 12:24
verses.text: But the word of God increased and multiplied.

verses.name: Acts 12:25
verses.text: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem when they had completed their service, bringing with them John, whose other name was Mark.

verses.name: Acts 13:1
verses.text: Now there were in the church at Antioch prophets and teachers, Barnabas, Simeon who was called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen a member of the court of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

verses.name: Acts 13:2
verses.text: While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, "Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them."

verses.name: Acts 13:3
verses.text: Then after fasting and praying they laid their hands on them and sent them off.

verses.name: Acts 13:4
verses.text: So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia, and from there they sailed to Cyprus.

verses.name: Acts 13:5
verses.text: When they arrived at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. And they had John to assist them.

verses.name: Acts 13:6
verses.text: When they had gone through the whole island as far as Paphos, they came upon a certain magician, a Jewish false prophet named Bar-Jesus.

verses.name: Acts 13:7
verses.text: He was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, a man of intelligence, who summoned Barnabas and Saul and sought to hear the word of God.

verses.name: Acts 13:8
verses.text: But Elymas the magician (for that is the meaning of his name) opposed them, seeking to turn the proconsul away from the faith.

verses.name: Acts 13:9
verses.text: But Saul, who was also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, looked intently at him

verses.name: Acts 13:10
verses.text: and said, "You son of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness, full of all deceit and villainy, will you not stop making crooked the straight paths of the Lord?

verses.name: Acts 13:11
verses.text: And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon you, and you will be blind and unable to see the sun for a time." Immediately mist and darkness fell upon him, and he went about seeking people to lead him by the hand.

verses.name: Acts 13:12
verses.text: Then the proconsul believed, when he saw what had occurred, for he was astonished at the teaching of the Lord.

verses.name: Acts 13:13
verses.text: Now Paul and his companions set sail from Paphos and came to Perga in Pamphylia. And John left them and returned to Jerusalem,

verses.name: Acts 13:14
verses.text: but they went on from Perga and came to Antioch in Pisidia. And on the Sabbath day they went into the synagogue and sat down.

verses.name: Acts 13:15
verses.text: After the reading from the Law and the Prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent a message to them, saying, "Brothers, if you have any word of exhortation for the people, say it."

verses.name: Acts 13:16
verses.text: So Paul stood up, and motioning with his hand said: "Men of Israel and you who fear God, listen.

verses.name: Acts 13:17
verses.text: The God of this people Israel chose our fathers and made the people great during their stay in the land of Egypt, and with uplifted arm he led them out of it.

verses.name: Acts 13:18
verses.text: And for about forty years he put up with them in the wilderness.

verses.name: Acts 13:19
verses.text: And after destroying seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them their land as an inheritance.

verses.name: Acts 13:20
verses.text: All this took about 450 years. And after that he gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.

verses.name: Acts 13:21
verses.text: Then they asked for a king, and God gave them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.

verses.name: Acts 13:22
verses.text: And when he had removed him, he raised up David to be their king, of whom he testified and said, 'I have found in David the son of Jesse a man after my heart, who will do all my will.'

verses.name: Acts 13:23
verses.text: Of this man's offspring God has brought to Israel a Savior, Jesus, as he promised.

verses.name: Acts 13:24
verses.text: Before his coming, John had proclaimed a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

verses.name: Acts 13:25
verses.text: And as John was finishing his course, he said, 'What do you suppose that I am? I am not he. No, but behold, after me one is coming, the sandals of whose feet I am not worthy to untie.'

verses.name: Acts 13:26
verses.text: "Brothers, sons of the family of Abraham, and those among you who fear God, to us has been sent the message of this salvation.

verses.name: Acts 13:27
verses.text: For those who live in Jerusalem and their rulers, because they did not recognize him nor understand the utterances of the prophets, which are read every Sabbath, fulfilled them by condemning him.

verses.name: Acts 13:28
verses.text: And though they found in him no guilt worthy of death, they asked Pilate to have him executed.

verses.name: Acts 13:29
verses.text: And when they had carried out all that was written of him, they took him down from the tree and laid him in a tomb.

verses.name: Acts 13:30
verses.text: But God raised him from the dead,

verses.name: Acts 13:31
verses.text: and for many days he appeared to those who had come up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are now his witnesses to the people.

verses.name: Acts 13:32
verses.text: And we bring you the good news that what God promised to the fathers,

verses.name: Acts 13:33
verses.text: this he has fulfilled to us their children by raising Jesus, as also it is written in the second Psalm, "' You are my Son, today I have begotten you.'

verses.name: Acts 13:34
verses.text: And as for the fact that he raised him from the dead, no more to return to corruption, he has spoken in this way, "' I will give you the holy and sure blessings of David.'

verses.name: Acts 13:35
verses.text: Therefore he says also in another psalm, "' You will not let your Holy One see corruption.'

verses.name: Acts 13:36
verses.text: For David, after he had served the purpose of God in his own generation, fell asleep and was laid with his fathers and saw corruption,

verses.name: Acts 13:37
verses.text: but he whom God raised up did not see corruption.

verses.name: Acts 13:38
verses.text: Let it be known to you therefore, brothers, that through this man forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you, and by him everyone who believes is freed from everything

verses.name: Acts 13:39
verses.text: from which you could not be freed by the law of Moses.

verses.name: Acts 13:40
verses.text: Beware, therefore, lest what is said in the Prophets should come about:

verses.name: Acts 13:41
verses.text: "'Look, you scoffers, be astounded and perish; for I am doing a work in your days, a work that you will not believe, even if one tells it to you.'"

verses.name: Acts 13:42
verses.text: As they went out, the people begged that these things might be told them the next Sabbath.

verses.name: Acts 13:43
verses.text: And after the meeting of the synagogue broke up, many Jews and devout converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas, who, as they spoke with them, urged them to continue in the grace of God.

verses.name: Acts 13:44
verses.text: The next Sabbath almost the whole city gathered to hear the word of the Lord.

verses.name: Acts 13:45
verses.text: But when the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy and began to contradict what was spoken by Paul, reviling him.

verses.name: Acts 13:46
verses.text: And Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly, saying, "It was necessary that the word of God be spoken first to you. Since you thrust it aside and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold, we are turning to the Gentiles.

verses.name: Acts 13:47
verses.text: For so the Lord has commanded us, saying, "' I have made you a light for the Gentiles, that you may bring salvation to the ends of the earth.'"

verses.name: Acts 13:48
verses.text: And when the Gentiles heard this, they began rejoicing and glorifying the word of the Lord, and as many as were appointed to eternal life believed.

verses.name: Acts 13:49
verses.text: And the word of the Lord was spreading throughout the whole region.

verses.name: Acts 13:50
verses.text: But the Jews incited the devout women of high standing and the leading men of the city, stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and drove them out of their district.

verses.name: Acts 13:51
verses.text: But they shook off the dust from their feet against them and went to Iconium.

verses.name: Acts 13:52
verses.text: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Acts 14:1
verses.text: Now at Iconium they entered together into the Jewish synagogue and spoke in such a way that a great number of both Jews and Greeks believed.

verses.name: Acts 14:2
verses.text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brothers.

verses.name: Acts 14:3
verses.text: So they remained for a long time, speaking boldly for the Lord, who bore witness to the word of his grace, granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

verses.name: Acts 14:4
verses.text: But the people of the city were divided; some sided with the Jews and some with the apostles.

verses.name: Acts 14:5
verses.text: When an attempt was made by both Gentiles and Jews, with their rulers, to mistreat them and to stone them,

verses.name: Acts 14:6
verses.text: they learned of it and fled to Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and to the surrounding country,

verses.name: Acts 14:7
verses.text: and there they continued to preach the gospel.

verses.name: Acts 14:8
verses.text: Now at Lystra there was a man sitting who could not use his feet. He was crippled from birth and had never walked.

verses.name: Acts 14:9
verses.text: He listened to Paul speaking. And Paul, looking intently at him and seeing that he had faith to be made well,

verses.name: Acts 14:10
verses.text: said in a loud voice, "Stand upright on your feet." And he sprang up and began walking.

verses.name: Acts 14:11
verses.text: And when the crowds saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in Lycaonian, "The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men!"

verses.name: Acts 14:12
verses.text: Barnabas they called Zeus, and Paul, Hermes, because he was the chief speaker.

verses.name: Acts 14:13
verses.text: And the priest of Zeus, whose temple was at the entrance to the city, brought oxen and garlands to the gates and wanted to offer sacrifice with the crowds.

verses.name: Acts 14:14
verses.text: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard of it, they tore their garments and rushed out into the crowd, crying out,

verses.name: Acts 14:15
verses.text: "Men, why are you doing these things? We also are men, of like nature with you, and we bring you good news, that you should turn from these vain things to a living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all that is in them.

verses.name: Acts 14:16
verses.text: In past generations he allowed all the nations to walk in their own ways.

verses.name: Acts 14:17
verses.text: Yet he did not leave himself without witness, for he did good by giving you rains from heaven and fruitful seasons, satisfying your hearts with food and gladness."

verses.name: Acts 14:18
verses.text: Even with these words they scarcely restrained the people from offering sacrifice to them.

verses.name: Acts 14:19
verses.text: But Jews came from Antioch and Iconium, and having persuaded the crowds, they stoned Paul and dragged him out of the city, supposing that he was dead.

verses.name: Acts 14:20
verses.text: But when the disciples gathered about him, he rose up and entered the city, and on the next day he went on with Barnabas to Derbe.

verses.name: Acts 14:21
